00013 /*!\fn static double double_swap( double value )
00014  *\brief Swap bytes endiannes for a double
00015  *\param value The double to swap
00016  *\return A swapped double
00017  */
00018 double double_swap( double value )
00019 {
00020    double swaped = 0 ;
00021    unsigned char *src = (unsigned char *)&value ;
00022    unsigned char *dst = (unsigned char *)&swaped ;
00023 
00024    /* swap bytes */
00025    dst[0] = src[7];
00026    dst[1] = src[6];
00027    dst[2] = src[5];
00028    dst[3] = src[4];
00029    dst[4] = src[3];
00030    dst[5] = src[2];
00031    dst[6] = src[1];
00032    dst[7] = src[0];
00033 
00034    return swaped ;
00035 } /* double_swap() */
00036 
00037 
00038 
00039 /*!\fn static double htond( double value )
00040  *\brief If needed swap bytes for a double 
00041  *\param value The value to eventually swap
00042  *\return The modified value
00043  */
00044 double htond( double value )
00045 {
00046    double ret = value ;
00047    /* if byte order is little like x86, PC, ... we swap to network notation */
00048 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00049    ret = double_swap( value );
00050 #endif
00051    return ret ;
00052 }
00053 
00054 
00055 
00056 /*!\fn static double ntohd( double value )
00057  *\brief If needed swap bytes for a double 
00058  *\param value The value to eventually swap
00059  *\return The modified value
00060  */
00061 double ntohd( double value )
00062 {
00063    double ret = value ;
00064    /* if byte order is little like x86, PC, ... we swap to network notation */
00065 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00066    ret = double_swap( value );
00067 #endif
00068    return ret ;
00069 }

00073 /*!\fn create_msg( NETW_MSG **msg )
00074  *\brief Create a NETW_MSG *object
00075  *\param msg A NETW_MSG *object
00076  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00077  */
00078 int create_msg( NETW_MSG **msg )
00079 {
00080    if( (*msg) )
00081    {
00082       n_log( LOG_ERR , "create_msg destination is valid and should be NULL !" );
00083       return FALSE;
00084    }
00085 
00086    Malloc( (*msg) , NETW_MSG , 1 );
00087    __n_assert( (*msg) , return FALSE );
00088 
00089    (*msg) -> tabstr = new_generic_list( -1 );
00090    __n_assert( (*msg) -> tabstr , return FALSE );
00091    (*msg) -> tabint = new_generic_list( -1 );
00092    __n_assert( (*msg) -> tabint , return FALSE );
00093    (*msg) -> tabflt = new_generic_list( -1 );
00094    __n_assert( (*msg) -> tabflt , return FALSE );
00095 
00096    return TRUE;
00097 } /* create_msg( ... ) */
00098 
00099 
00100 
00101 /*!\fn delete_msg( NETW_MSG **msg )
00102  *\brief Delete a NETW_MSG *object
00103  *\param msg A NETW_MSG *object to delete
00104  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00105  */
00106 int delete_msg( NETW_MSG **msg )
00107 {
00108    if( (*msg) )
00109    {
00110       if( (*msg) -> tabint )
00111       {
00112          list_destroy( &(*msg) -> tabint );
00113       }
00114       if( (*msg) -> tabflt )
00115       {
00116          list_destroy( &(*msg) -> tabflt );
00117       }
00118       if( (*msg) -> tabstr )
00119       {
00120          list_destroy( &(*msg) -> tabstr );
00121       }
00122       Free( (*msg) );
00123    }
00124    else
00125    {
00126       n_log( LOG_ERR , "(*msg) already NULL" );
00127       return FALSE ;
00128    }
00129    return TRUE;
00130 } /* delete_msg */

00134 /*!\fn empty_msg( NETW_MSG **msg )
00135  *\brief Empty a NETW_MSG *object
00136  *\param msg A NETW_MSG **object
00137  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00138  */
00139 int empty_msg( NETW_MSG **msg )
00140 {
00141    __n_assert( (*msg) , return FALSE ); 
00142 
00143    list_empty( (*msg) -> tabint );
00144    list_empty( (*msg) -> tabflt );
00145    list_empty( (*msg) -> tabstr );
00146 
00147    return TRUE;
00148 } /* empty_msg(...) */

00152 /*!\fn add_nb_to_msg( NETW_MSG *msg , double value )
00153  *\brief Add an float to the message
00154  *\param msg A NETW_MSG *object to complete with the value
00155  *\param value The value to add to the message
00156  *\warning The floating value will be rounded by the network serialization !
00157  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00158  */
00159 int add_nb_to_msg( NETW_MSG *msg , double value )
00160 {
00161    double *new_val = NULL ;
00162 
00163    __n_assert( msg , return FALSE );
00164 
00165    Malloc( new_val , double , 1 );
00166    __n_assert( new_val , return FALSE );
00167 
00168    new_val[ 0 ] = value ;
00169 
00170    return list_push( msg -> tabflt , new_val , free );
00171 } /* add_nb_to_msg( ... ) */

00198  *\brief Add a string to the string list in the message
00199  *\param msg A NETW_MSG *object to complete with the string
00200  *\param str The string to add to the message
00201  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00202  */
00203 int add_nstrptr_to_msg( NETW_MSG *msg , N_STR *str )
00204 {
00205    __n_assert( msg , return FALSE );
00206    __n_assert( str , return FALSE );
00207    __n_assert( str -> data , return FALSE );
00208    return list_push( msg -> tabstr , str , free_nstr_ptr );
00209 } /* add_nstrptr_to_msg(...) */

00231 /*!\fn add_strdup_to_msg( NETW_MSG *msg , char *str)
00232  *\brief Add a copy of char *str to the string list in the message
00233  *\param msg A NETW_MSG *object to complete with the string
00234  *\param str The string to add to the message
00235  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00236  */
00237 int add_strdup_to_msg( NETW_MSG *msg , char *str )
00238 {
00239    __n_assert( msg , return FALSE );
00240    __n_assert( str , return FALSE );
00241 
00242    N_STR *dup = char_to_nstr( str );
00243    __n_assert( dup , return FALSE );
00244 
00245    return list_push( msg -> tabstr , dup , free_nstr_ptr );
00246 } /* add_strdup_to_msg(...) */

00251 /*!\fn int get_nb_from_msg( NETW_MSG *msg , double *value )
00252  *\brief Get a number from a message number list
00253  *\param msg A NETW_MSG *object for extracting number
00254  *\param value A int value where you want to store the result
00255  *\return A pointer to the N_STR, Do not forget to free it !
00256  */
00257 int get_nb_from_msg( NETW_MSG *msg , double *value )
00258 {
00259    double *val = NULL ;
00260 
00261    __n_assert( msg , return FALSE );
00262 
00263    val = list_shift( msg -> tabflt , double );
00264    if( val )
00265    {
00266       (*value) = val[ 0 ] ;
00267       Free( val );
00268       return TRUE;
00269    }        
00270    return FALSE;
00271 } /* get_nb_from_msg(...) */

00300 /*!\fn get_nstr_from_msg( NETW_MSG *msg , N_STR **value )
00301  *\brief Get a string from a message string list
00302  *\param msg The NETW_MSG where you have a str to get
00303  *\param value A pointer to a NULL N_STR for storage
00304  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00305  */
00306 int get_nstr_from_msg( NETW_MSG *msg , N_STR **value )
00307 {
00308    N_STR *val = NULL ;
00309 
00310    __n_assert( msg , return FALSE );
00311    
00312    val = list_shift( msg -> tabstr , N_STR );
00313    if( val )
00314    {
00315       if( (*value) )
00316       {
00317          n_log( LOG_ERR , "Previous pointer value %p overriden by pointer %p" , (*value) , val );  
00318       }
00319       (*value) = val ;
00320       return TRUE;
00321    }        
00322    return FALSE;
00323 } /* get_nstr_from_msg(...) */

00330  *\param value A pointer to a NULL N_STR for storage

00333 int get_str_from_msg( NETW_MSG *msg , char **value )

00335    N_STR *val = NULL ;
00336 
00337    __n_assert( msg , return FALSE );
00338    
00339    val = list_shift( msg -> tabstr , N_STR );
00340    if( val )
00341    {
00342       if( (*value) )
00343       {
00344          n_log( LOG_ERR , "Previous pointer value %p overriden by pointer %p" , (*value) , val );  
00345       }
00346 
00347       (*value) = val -> data ;
00348       Free( val );
00349       return TRUE;
00350    }        
00351    return FALSE;
00352 } /* get_str_from_msg(...) */

00356 /*!\fn make_str_from_msg( NETW_MSG *msg )
00357  *\brief Make a single string of the message
00358  *\param msg A NETW_MSG structure to convert into a N_STR one
00359  *\return A pointer to the generated N_STR, do not forget to free it after use !
00360  */
00361 N_STR *make_str_from_msg( NETW_MSG *msg )
00362 {
00363    int str_length = 0  ;
00364    LIST_NODE *node = NULL ;
00365 
00366    N_STR *strptr = NULL ,
00367          *generated_str = NULL ;
00368 
00369    char *charptr = NULL ;
00370 
00371    __n_assert( msg , return NULL );
00372 
00373    /* the first thing to do is to computer the resulting string size
00374       the first 12 octets are for the number of ints , floats, strings in the message 
00375       */
00376    str_length = 3 * sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) + ( msg -> tabint -> nb_items * sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) ) + ( msg -> tabflt -> nb_items * sizeof( double ) ) ;
00377 
00378    /* let's count the eventual string blocks */
00379    node = msg -> tabstr -> start ;
00380    while( node )
00381    {
00382       strptr = (N_STR *)node -> ptr ;
00383       str_length += sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) + sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) + strptr -> written ;
00384       node = node -> next ;
00385    }
00386 
00387    /* preparing the new string */
00388    Malloc( generated_str , N_STR , 1 );
00389    __n_assert( generated_str , return NULL );
00390    Malloc( generated_str -> data , char , str_length + 1 );
00391    __n_assert( generated_str -> data , return NULL );
00392    
00393    generated_str -> length = str_length + 1 ;
00394    generated_str -> written = str_length ;
00395 
00396 
00397    /* copying header */
00398    charptr = generated_str -> data ;
00399 
00400    /* byte order */
00401    msg -> tabint -> nb_items = htonl( msg -> tabint -> nb_items );
00402    msg -> tabflt -> nb_items = htonl( msg -> tabflt -> nb_items );
00403    msg -> tabstr -> nb_items = htonl( msg -> tabstr -> nb_items );
00404 
00405    /* number of ints inside the message */
00406    memcpy ( charptr , &msg -> tabint -> nb_items , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
00407    charptr += sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) ;
00408    /* number of doubles inside the message */
00409    memcpy ( charptr , &msg -> tabflt -> nb_items , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
00410    charptr += sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) ;
00411    /* number of string inside the message */
00412    memcpy ( charptr , &msg -> tabstr -> nb_items , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
00413    charptr += sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) ;
00414 
00415    /*reversing byte order to default host order */
00416    msg -> tabint -> nb_items = ntohl( msg -> tabint -> nb_items );
00417    msg -> tabflt -> nb_items = ntohl( msg -> tabflt -> nb_items );
00418    msg -> tabstr -> nb_items = ntohl( msg -> tabstr -> nb_items );
00419 
00420    /* if there are numbers, copy all them ! */
00421    node = msg -> tabint -> start ;
00422    while( node )
00423    {
00424       NSTRBYTE *nbptr = (NSTRBYTE *)node -> ptr ;
00425       int val = htonl( nbptr[ 0 ] );
00426       memcpy( charptr , &val , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
00427       charptr += sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) ;
00428       node = node -> next ;
00429    }
00430 
00431    /* if there are numbers, copy all them ! */
00432    node = msg -> tabflt -> start ;
00433    while( node )
00434    {
00435       double *nbptr = (double *)node -> ptr ;
00436       double val = htond( nbptr[ 0 ] );
00437       memcpy( charptr , &val , sizeof( double ) );
00438       charptr += sizeof( double ) ;
00439       node = node -> next ;
00440    }
00441 
00442    /* if there are strings, copy all them ! */
00443    if( msg -> tabstr -> nb_items > 0 )
00444    {
00445       node = msg -> tabstr -> start ;
00446       while( node )
00447       {
00448          strptr = (N_STR *)node -> ptr ;
00449 
00450          strptr -> length = htonl( strptr -> length );
00451          memcpy( charptr , &strptr -> length , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
00452          charptr += sizeof( NSTRBYTE );
00453          strptr -> length = ntohl( strptr -> length );
00454 
00455          strptr -> written = htonl( strptr -> written );
00456          memcpy( charptr , &strptr -> written , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
00457          charptr += sizeof( NSTRBYTE );
00458          strptr -> written = ntohl( strptr -> written );
00459 
00460          memcpy( charptr , strptr -> data , strptr -> written );
00461          charptr += strptr -> written ;
00462          node = node -> next ;
00463       }
00464 
00465    }
00466 
00467    return generated_str;
00468 } /* make_str_from_msg(...) */
00469 
00470 
00471 
00472 /*!\fn make_msg_from_str( N_STR *str )
00473  *\brief Make a single message of the string
00474  *\param str A N_STR structure to convert into a NETW_MSG one
00475  *\return A pointer to the generated NETW_MSG, do not forget to free it after use !
00476  */
00477 NETW_MSG *make_msg_from_str( N_STR *str )
00478 {
00479    NETW_MSG *generated_msg = NULL ;
00480    N_STR    *tmpstr = NULL;
00481 
00482    char     *charptr = NULL;
00483 
00484    NSTRBYTE it ,
00485             nb_int = 0 ,
00486             nb_flt = 0 ,
00487             nb_str = 0 ,
00488             tmpnb = 0 ;
00489    
00490    double tmpflt = 0 ;
00491 
00492    __n_assert( str , return NULL );
00493 
00494    charptr = str -> data;
00495 
00496    create_msg( &generated_msg );
00497 
00498    __n_assert( generated_msg , return NULL );
00499 
00500    memcpy( &nb_int , charptr , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
00501    charptr += sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) ;
00502    nb_int = ntohl( nb_int );
00503 
00504    memcpy( &nb_flt , charptr , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
00505    charptr += sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) ;
00506    nb_flt = ntohl( nb_flt );
00507 
00508    memcpy( &nb_str , charptr , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
00509    charptr += sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) ;
00510    nb_str = ntohl( nb_str );
00511 
00512    if( nb_int > 0 )
00513    {
00514       for( it = 0 ; it < nb_int ; it ++ )
00515       {
00516          memcpy( &tmpnb , charptr , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) ) ;
00517          tmpnb = ntohl( tmpnb );
00518          charptr += sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) ;
00519          add_int_to_msg( generated_msg , tmpnb );
00520       }
00521    }
00522 
00523    if( nb_flt > 0 )
00524    {
00525       for( it = 0 ; it < nb_flt ; it ++ )
00526       {
00527          memcpy( &tmpflt , charptr , sizeof( double ) ) ;
00528          tmpflt = ntohd( tmpflt );
00529          charptr += sizeof( double ) ;
00530          add_nb_to_msg( generated_msg , tmpflt );
00531       }
00532    }
00533 
00534 
00535    if( nb_str > 0 )
00536    {
00537       for( it = 0 ; it < nb_str ; it ++ )
00538       {
00539 
00540          Malloc( tmpstr , N_STR , 1 );
00541          __n_assert( tmpstr , return NULL );
00542 
00543          memcpy( &tmpstr -> length , charptr , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
00544          charptr += sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) ;
00545          memcpy( &tmpstr -> written , charptr , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) );
00546          charptr += sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) ;
00547 
00548          tmpstr -> length  = ntohl( tmpstr -> length );
00549          tmpstr -> written = ntohl( tmpstr -> written );
00550 
00551          Malloc( tmpstr -> data , char , tmpstr -> length );
00552          __n_assert( tmpstr -> data , return NULL );
00553 
00554          memcpy( tmpstr -> data , charptr , tmpstr -> written );
00555          charptr += tmpstr -> written ;
00556 
00557          add_nstrptr_to_msg( generated_msg , tmpstr );
00558       }
00559    }
00560    return generated_msg ;
00561 } /* make_msg_from_str(...) */
00562

00564 
00565 /*!\fn netw_msg_get_type( N_STR *msg )
00566  *\param msg A char *msg_object you want to have type
00567  *\brief Get the type of message without killing the first number. Use with netw_get_XXX
00568  *\return The value corresponding to the type or FALSE
00569  */
00570 int netw_msg_get_type( N_STR *msg )
00571 {
00572    NSTRBYTE tmpnb = 0 ;
00573    char *charptr = NULL ;
00574 
00575    __n_assert( msg , return FALSE );
00576 
00577    charptr = msg -> data ;
00578 
00579    /* here we bypass the number of int, numebr of flt, number of str, (4+4+4) to get the
00580     * first number which should be type */
00581    charptr += 3 * sizeof( NSTRBYTE );
00582    memcpy( &tmpnb , charptr , sizeof( NSTRBYTE ) ) ;
00583    tmpnb = ntohl( tmpnb );
00584 
00585    return tmpnb;
00586 } /* netw_msg_get_type(...) */

00590 /*!\fn int netw_send_ident( NETWORK *netw , int type , int id , N_STR *name , N_STR *passwd  )
00591  *\brief Add a formatted NETWMSG_IDENT message to the specified network
00592  *\param netw The aimed NETWORK where we want to add something to send
00593  *\param type type of identification ( NETW_IDENT_REQUEST , NETW_IDENT_NEW )
00594  *\param id The ID of the sending client
00595  *\param name Username
00596  *\param passwd Password
00597  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00598  */
00599 int netw_send_ident( NETWORK *netw , int type , int id , N_STR *name , N_STR *passwd  )
00600 {
00601    NETW_MSG *msg = NULL ;
00602    N_STR *tmpstr = NULL ;
00603 
00604    __n_assert( netw , return FALSE );
00605 
00606    create_msg( &msg );
00607 
00608    __n_assert( msg , return FALSE );
00609 
00610    add_int_to_msg( msg , type );
00611    add_int_to_msg( msg , id );
00612 
00613    add_nstrdup_to_msg( msg , name );
00614    add_nstrdup_to_msg( msg , passwd );
00615 
00616    tmpstr = make_str_from_msg( msg );
00617    delete_msg( &msg );
00618    __n_assert( tmpstr , return FALSE );
00619 
00620    return netw_add_msg( netw , tmpstr );
00621 } /* netw_send_ident( ... ) */
00622

00624 
00625 /*!\fn netw_send_position( NETWORK *netw , int id , double X , double Y , double vx , double vy , double acc_x , double acc_y , int time_stamp )
00626  *\brief Add a formatted NETWMSG_IDENT message to the specified network
00627  *\param netw The aimed NETWORK where we want to add something to send
00628  *\param id The ID of the sending client
00629  *\param X X position inside a big grid
00630  *\param Y Y position inside a big grid
00631  *\param vx X speed
00632  *\param vy Y speed
00633  *\param acc_x Y acceleration
00634  *\param acc_y X acceleration
00635  *\param time_stamp Current Time when sending (for some delta we would want to compute )
00636  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00637  */
00638 int netw_send_position( NETWORK *netw , int id , double X , double Y , double vx , double vy , double acc_x , double acc_y , int time_stamp )
00639 {
00640    NETW_MSG *msg = NULL ;
00641    N_STR *tmpstr = NULL ;
00642 
00643    __n_assert( netw , return FALSE );
00644 
00645    create_msg( &msg );
00646 
00647    __n_assert( msg , return FALSE );
00648 
00649    add_int_to_msg( msg , NETMSG_POSITION );
00650    add_int_to_msg( msg , id );
00651    add_nb_to_msg( msg , X );
00652    add_nb_to_msg( msg , Y );
00653    add_nb_to_msg( msg , vx );
00654    add_nb_to_msg( msg , vy );
00655    add_nb_to_msg( msg , acc_x );
00656    add_nb_to_msg( msg , acc_y );
00657    add_int_to_msg( msg , time_stamp );
00658 
00659    tmpstr = make_str_from_msg( msg );
00660    delete_msg( &msg );
00661    __n_assert( tmpstr , return FALSE );
00662 
00663    return netw_add_msg( netw , tmpstr );
00664 } /* netw_send_position( ... ) */

00668 /*!\fn netw_send_string_to_all( NETWORK *netw , int id , char *name , char *chan , char *txt , int color )
00669  *\brief Add a string to the network, aiming all server-side users
00670  *\param netw The aimed NETWORK where we want to add something to send
00671  *\param id The ID of the sending client
00672  *\param name Name of user
00673  *\param chan Target Channel, if any. Pass "ALL" to target the default channel
00674  *\param txt The text to send
00675  *\param color The color of the text
00676  *\return TRUE or FALSE;
00677  */
00678 
00679 int netw_send_string_to_all( NETWORK *netw , int id , char *name , char *chan , char *txt , int color )
00680 {
00681    NETW_MSG *msg = NULL ;
00682 
00683    N_STR *namestr  = NULL ,
00684          *chanstr  = NULL ,
00685          *txtstr   = NULL ,
00686          *tmpstr   = NULL ;
00687 
00688    __n_assert( netw , return FALSE );
00689 
00690    create_msg( &msg );
00691    __n_assert( msg , return FALSE );
00692 
00693    namestr = char_to_nstr( name );
00694    __n_assert( namestr , delete_msg( &msg ); return FALSE );
00695 
00696    chanstr = char_to_nstr( chan );
00697    __n_assert( chanstr , delete_msg( &msg ); free_nstr( &namestr ); return FALSE );
00698 
00699    txtstr = char_to_nstr( txt );
00700    __n_assert( txtstr , delete_msg( &msg ); free_nstr( &namestr ); free_nstr( &chanstr ); return FALSE );
00701 
00702    n_log( LOG_DEBUG , "send_string_to_all( %d:%d:%d , %s , %s , %s )" ,NETMSG_STRING,id,color, namestr -> data , chanstr -> data , txtstr -> data );
00703 
00704    add_int_to_msg( msg , NETMSG_STRING );
00705    add_int_to_msg( msg , id );
00706    add_int_to_msg( msg , color );
00707 
00708    add_nstrptr_to_msg( msg , namestr );
00709    add_nstrptr_to_msg( msg , chanstr );
00710    add_nstrptr_to_msg( msg , txtstr );
00711 
00712    tmpstr = make_str_from_msg( msg );
00713 
00714    delete_msg( &msg );
00715 
00716    __n_assert( tmpstr , return FALSE );
00717 
00718    return netw_add_msg( netw , tmpstr );
00719 } /* netw_send_string_to_all( ... ) */

00723 /*!\fn netw_send_string_to( NETWORK *netw , int id_from , int id_to , char *name , char *txt , int color )
00724  *\brief Add a string to the network, aiming a specific user
00725  *\param netw The aimed NETWORK where we want to add something to send
00726  *\param id_from The ID of the sending client
00727  *\param id_to The ID of the targetted client
00728  *\param name Sender Name
00729  *\param txt Sender text
00730  *\param color Sender text color
00731  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00732  */
00733 int netw_send_string_to( NETWORK *netw , int id_from , int id_to , char *name , char *txt , int color )
00734 {
00735    NETW_MSG *msg = NULL ;
00736 
00737    N_STR *namestr = NULL ,
00738          *txtstr  = NULL ,
00739          *tmpstr  = NULL ;
00740 
00741    __n_assert( netw , return FALSE );
00742 
00743    create_msg( &msg );
00744 
00745    __n_assert( msg , return FALSE );
00746 
00747    namestr = char_to_nstr( name );
00748    __n_assert( namestr , delete_msg( &msg ); return FALSE );
00749 
00750    txtstr = char_to_nstr( txt );
00751    __n_assert( txtstr , delete_msg( &msg ); free_nstr( &namestr ); return FALSE );
00752 
00753    add_int_to_msg( msg , NETMSG_STRING );
00754    add_int_to_msg( msg , id_from );
00755    add_int_to_msg( msg , id_to );
00756    add_int_to_msg( msg , color );
00757 
00758 
00759    add_nstrptr_to_msg( msg , namestr );
00760    add_nstrptr_to_msg( msg , txtstr );
00761 
00762    tmpstr = make_str_from_msg( msg );
00763 
00764    delete_msg( &msg );
00765 
00766    __n_assert( tmpstr , return FALSE );
00767 
00768    return netw_add_msg( netw , tmpstr );

00773 /*!\fn netw_send_ping( NETWORK *netw , int id_from , int id_to , int time , int type )
00774  *\brief Add a ping reply to the network
00775  *\param netw The aimed NETWORK where we want to add something to send
00776  *\param id_from Identifiant of the sender
00777  *\param id_to Identifiant of the destination, -1 if the serveur itslef is targetted
00778  *\param time The time it was when the ping was sended
00779  *\param type NETW_PING_REQUEST or NETW_PING_REPLY
00780  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00781  */
00782 int netw_send_ping( NETWORK *netw , int type , int id_from , int id_to , int time )
00783 {
00784    NETW_MSG *msg = NULL ;
00785 
00786    N_STR *tmpstr = NULL ;
00787 
00788    __n_assert( netw , return FALSE );
00789 
00790    create_msg( &msg );
00791 
00792    __n_assert( msg , return FALSE );
00793 
00794    add_int_to_msg( msg , type );
00795    add_int_to_msg( msg , id_from );
00796    add_int_to_msg( msg , id_to );
00797    add_int_to_msg( msg , time );
00798 
00799    tmpstr = make_str_from_msg( msg );
00800 
00801    delete_msg( &msg );
00802 
00803    __n_assert( tmpstr , return FALSE );
00804 
00805    return netw_add_msg( netw , tmpstr );
00806 } /* netw_send_ping( ... ) */

00809 /*!\fn  int netw_get_ident( N_STR *msg , int *type ,int *ident , N_STR **name , N_STR **passwd  )
00810  *\brief Retrieves identification from netwmsg
00811  *\param msg The source string from which we are going to extract the data
00812  *\param type NETMSG_IDENT_NEW , NETMSG_IDENT_REPLY_OK , NETMSG_IDENT_REPLY_NOK , NETMSG_IDENT_REQUEST
00813  *\param ident ID for the user
00814  *\param name Name of the user
00815  *\param passwd Password of the user
00816  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00817  */
00818 int netw_get_ident( N_STR *msg , int *type ,int *ident , N_STR **name , N_STR **passwd  )
00819 {
00820    NETW_MSG *netmsg = NULL ;
00821 
00822    __n_assert( msg , return FALSE);
00823 
00824    netmsg = make_msg_from_str( msg );
00825 
00826    __n_assert( netmsg , return FALSE);
00827 
00828    get_int_from_msg( netmsg , &(*type) );
00829    get_int_from_msg( netmsg , &(*ident) );
00830 
00831    if( (*type) != NETMSG_IDENT_REQUEST && (*type) != NETMSG_IDENT_REPLY_OK && (*type) != NETMSG_IDENT_REPLY_NOK )
00832    {
00833       n_log( LOG_ERR, "unknow (*type) %d" , (*type) );
00834       delete_msg( &netmsg );
00835       return FALSE;
00836    }
00837 
00838    get_nstr_from_msg( netmsg , &(*name) );
00839    get_nstr_from_msg( netmsg , &(*passwd) );
00840 
00841    delete_msg( &netmsg );
00842 
00843    return TRUE;
00844 } /* netw_get_ident( ... ) */

00848 /*!\fn int netw_get_position( N_STR *msg , int *id , double *X , double *Y , double *vx , double *vy , double *acc_x , double *acc_y , int *time_stamp )
00849  *\brief Retrieves position from netwmsg
00850  *\param msg The source string from which we are going to extract the data
00851  *\param id
00852  *\param X X position inside a big grid
00853  *\param Y Y position inside a big grid
00854  *\param vx X speed
00855  *\param vy Y speed
00856  *\param acc_x X acceleration
00857  *\param acc_y Y acceleration
00858  *\param time_stamp Current Time when it was sended (for some delta we would want to compute )
00859  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00860  */
00861 int netw_get_position( N_STR *msg , int *id , double *X , double *Y , double *vx , double *vy , double *acc_x , double *acc_y , int *time_stamp )
00862 {
00863    NETW_MSG *netmsg = NULL ;
00864 
00865    int type = 0 ;
00866 
00867    __n_assert( msg , return FALSE );
00868 
00869    netmsg = make_msg_from_str( msg );
00870 
00871    __n_assert( netmsg , return FALSE );
00872 
00873    get_int_from_msg( netmsg , &type );
00874 
00875    if( type != NETMSG_POSITION )
00876    {
00877       delete_msg( &netmsg );
00878       return FALSE;
00879    }
00880 
00881    get_int_from_msg( netmsg , &(*id) );
00882    get_nb_from_msg( netmsg ,  &(*X) );
00883    get_nb_from_msg( netmsg ,  &(*Y) );
00884    get_nb_from_msg( netmsg ,  &(*vx) );
00885    get_nb_from_msg( netmsg ,  &(*vy) );
00886    get_nb_from_msg( netmsg ,  &(*acc_x) );
00887    get_nb_from_msg( netmsg ,  &(*acc_y) );
00888    get_int_from_msg( netmsg , &(*time_stamp) );
00889 
00890    delete_msg( &netmsg );
00891 
00892    return TRUE;
00893 } /* netw_get_position( ... ) */

00897 /*!\fn netw_get_string( N_STR *msg , int *id , N_STR **name , N_STR **chan , N_STR **txt , int *color )
00898  *\brief Retrieves string from netwmsg
00899  *\param msg The source string from which we are going to extract the data
00900  *\param id The ID of the sending client
00901  *\param name Name of user
00902  *\param chan Target Channel, if any. Pass "ALL" to target the default channel
00903  *\param txt The text to send
00904  *\param color The color of the text
00905  *
00906  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00907  */
00908 int netw_get_string( N_STR *msg , int *id , N_STR **name , N_STR **chan , N_STR **txt , int *color )
00909 {
00910    NETW_MSG *netmsg = NULL;
00911 
00912    int type = 0 ;
00913 
00914    __n_assert( msg , return FALSE );
00915 
00916    netmsg = make_msg_from_str( msg );
00917 
00918    __n_assert( netmsg , return FALSE );
00919 
00920    get_int_from_msg( netmsg , &type );
00921 
00922    if( type != NETMSG_STRING )
00923    {
00924       delete_msg( &netmsg );
00925       return FALSE;
00926    }
00927 
00928    get_int_from_msg( netmsg , id );
00929    get_int_from_msg( netmsg , color );
00930 
00931   get_nstr_from_msg( netmsg , &(*name) );
00932   get_nstr_from_msg( netmsg , &(*chan) );
00933   get_nstr_from_msg( netmsg , &(*txt) );
00934 
00935    delete_msg( &netmsg );
00936 
00937    return TRUE;
00938 
00939 } /* netw_get_string( ... ) */

00943 /*!\fn netw_get_ping( N_STR *msg , int *type , int *from , int *to , int *time )
00944  *\brief Retrieves a ping travel elapsed time
00945  *\param msg The source string from which we are going to extract the data
00946  *\param type NETW_PING_REQUEST or NETW_PING_REPLY
00947  *\param from Identifiant of the sender
00948  *\param to Targetted Identifiant, -1 for server ping
00949  *\param time The time it was when the ping was sended
00950  *
00951  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00952  */
00953 
00954 int netw_get_ping( N_STR *msg , int *type , int *from , int *to , int *time )
00955 {
00956    NETW_MSG *netmsg;
00957 
00958    __n_assert( msg , return FALSE );
00959 
00960    netmsg = make_msg_from_str( msg );
00961 
00962    __n_assert( netmsg , return FALSE );
00963 
00964    get_int_from_msg( netmsg , &(*type) );
00965 
00966    if( (*type) != NETMSG_PING_REQUEST && (*type) != NETMSG_PING_REPLY )
00967    {
00968       delete_msg( &netmsg );
00969       return FALSE;
00970    }
00971 
00972    get_int_from_msg( netmsg , &(*from) );
00973    get_int_from_msg( netmsg , &(*to) );
00974    get_int_from_msg( netmsg , &(*time) );
00975 
00976 
00977    delete_msg( &netmsg );
00978 
00979    return TRUE;
00980 } /* netw_get_ping( ... ) */
